segments.text:
In a few moments Denver City Council will be called to order, the weekly meeting begins
with the delivery of formal communications followed by individual proclamations brought
forward by council members.
The first portion of the meeting concludes with the reading of new legislation.

After a brief recess, Council will consider bills for final passage, including public
hearings on a variety of zoning and other matters.
Denverate's coverage begins with these agenda highlights.

We'll begin a look at this Monday, May 11, turning directly to a resolution 264, which
sets a public hearing on June 1, for the Rhino Business Improvement District.

Underbills for introduction, Council Bill 257 amends the agreement for the design and
construction of the light rail station located at 61st and Peña Boulevard.

Council Bill 258 approves a 40-year development agreement for the construction of phase 1
improvements at the Peña station area.

Council Bill 256 approves the intergovernmental agreement with the City of Englewood to
provide fire protection services.
And Council Bill 268 revises the Denver Municipal Code regarding tobacco products.
Now let's look at bills for final consideration.
There are no public hearings on this agenda.

Other bills of note include Council Bill 239, which is a lease purchase agreement, to
finance the 911 Communications Center.

And Council Bill 176, which adds $200,000 for additional design services at the Central
Denver Recreation Center.

And that's a quick look at this Monday, May 11, meeting with Denver City Council, meeting
as chaired by Council President Chris Herndon, and will begin in a moment.
Ladies and gentlemen, we are up in the green light as on, so we will go ahead and begin.

On the second Monday of most months, the Denver City Council celebrates an aid in the
implementation of Imagine 2020, Denver's cultural plan, by featuring a poet, musician, or
performer at the beginning of council meetings.

Built on seven vision elements, Imagine 2020 sets forward several strategic goals,
including integrating the arts into daily life, making the arts more accessible, and
ensuring that Denver creators can thrive.
We encourage all of Denver to do as part to implement Imagine 2020.
Please visit www.imaginedember2020.org for more information.
Tonight's performance is by The Spiritual Project, directed by Darrell J. Walker.
The Spiritual Project is a nonprofit organization based at the University of Denver.

Their mission is a preservation and revitalization of the sacred folk songs that were
created and first sung by enslaved Africans in America in the 18th and 19th centuries.

The organization accomplishes its work through research, education, and creative
performance centered on a commitment to social justice.
Please visit www.imaginedember2020.org for more information.
Please visit www.imaginedember2020.org for more information.
I want to welcome everyone to the Denver City Council meeting of Monday, May 11, 2015.
Please rise and join Councilman Brooks and the Pledge of Allegiance.
Any corrections to the minutes of May 4, 2015?
Any announcements from members of Council?

Well, Mr. President, you know, I know there's a separation of church and state, but we
just had a little church in here.

I just want to say publicly that I was probably one of the most encouraging songs and just
groups that I've witnessed here.
So thank you guys so much for being here.
That was very encouraging for a long Monday.
Madam Secretary, do we have any presentations?
Madam Secretary, do we have any communications?
Madam Secretary, do we have any proclamations?
Well, then we are on to the resolutions.
Madam Secretary, please read the resolutions.

From Business Development 264, a resolution to Senate Public Hearing on the petitions
submitted for the creation and establishment of the Rhino Business Improvement District
proving the initial operating plan in preliminary 2016 budget, 265, a resolution to set a
public hearing on the petitions submitted for the creation, stashing the Rhino Denver
General Improvement District, proving the initial operating plan in preliminary 2016
budget, safety and well being 225, resolution proving the mayor's reappointing and
appointments to the Denver Office as Strategic Partnerships Commission 251, resolution
proving the mayor's reappointing and appointing the Denver African-American Commission.
Now on to the bills for introduction.
Will you please read the bills for introduction.

Business Development 257, bill 4, Nordens, prudent post-second and mandatory agreement to
intergovernmental agreement for fast tracks, East Corridor Denver International Airport,
between City and County Denver Regional Transportation District related to design and
construction of the Gateway Station at 61st Avenue in Penny Boulevard 258.

Bill 4, Nordens, prudent post-development agreement between City and County Denver and
rail stop LLC related to the Penny Station transit-oriented development 259A, bill 4,
Nordens, prudent post intergovernmental agreement regarding Penny Station area
improvements between City and County and Denver Aviation Station North Metropolitan
District number 1 concerning financing, design, contracting and construction related to
public improvements for development of the Peña Station area, 260, a bill for Nordens,
pre-and-opposed projects, improvements, reimbursement agreement between City and County
Denver, North Metro Metropolitan District number 1 and Smith Metropolitan District number
1 related to Penny Station development area 261, a bill for Nordens approving a proposed
additional project improvements, reimbursement agreement between City and County and
Denver and Aviation Station North Metropolitan District number 1 concerning payment of the
reimbursement obligation by the District for the Penny Station development area, 262A bill
for Nordens, a pre-and-opposed contract between City and County Denver, and John Roar
Contracting Company Incorporated for Uncall Parking garage repairs at Denver International
Airport 263, bill 4 Nordens pre-and-opposed agreement for professional services between
City and County Denver and Applied Research Associates, Incorporated for Airfield Payment
Evaluation 2015 at Denver International Airport from Safety and Wellbeing 191, bill 4
Nordens pre-and-opposed agreement between City and County Denver and School District
number 1 for the provision of school resource officers during 2015-2016 school year, 213A
bill for Nordens, many article 8 of chapter 2 of the revisement, so code of the City and
County of Denver by amending a language of sections 2-191, 2-193, and a deleting section
2-193 which shall be and is relocated to Division 4 section 39-88 of article 2 of chapter
39 of the revisement code of the City and County of Denver 229, bill 4 Nordens pre-and-
opposed agreement between City and County Denver and Third Way Center, incorporated right
out of home placement services for children youth in the custody of the Department of
Human Services, 238, bill 4 Nordens, pre-and-opposed agreement between City and County of
Denver and Tennyson Center for Children and Color Christian Home to out of home placement
services for children youth in the custody of the Department of Human Services, 231, 8,
bill 4 Nordens, approving an agreement between City and County Denver and lost in
construction company for public infrastructure along Inkton Street from 38th Avenue, 42nd
Avenue, 232, 8, bill 4 Nordens pre-and-opposed agreement between City and County Denver
and Aerial Clinical Services provide out-of-home placement services for children youth in
the custody of the Department of Human Services, 233, bill 4 Nordens, approving a proposed
agreement between City and County and Denver and Denver area youth services to provide
out-of-home placement services for children youth in the custody of the Department of
Human Services, 234, 8, bill 4 Nordens, approving a proposed agreement between City and
County different right of passage incorporated to provide out-of-home placement services
for children youth in the custody of the Department of Human Services, 235, 8, bill 4
Nordens, approving a proposed agreement between City and County and a new world child
placement agency to provide out-of-home placement services for children youth in custody
of the Department of Human Services 256-A-Bill Ford Nordens approving the
intergovernmental agreement with City of Englewood for the provisions of fire protection
and emergency medical services within the boundaries of the City of Englewood 268-A-Bill
Ford Nordens amending Division 3 of Article 1 of Chapter 24 of the revised municipal code
of the City and County of Denver regarding the sale of tobacco products.

All right council members this is your last opportunity to call out any bills or

no bills for introduction called out bills for final councilwoman thoughts 239 and under

please have 239 place on final consideration and do pass thanks Mr. President I put

a second it's been moved and seconded comments councilwoman thoughts thank you mr.
President this is the ordinance that issues allows the issuance of certificates of
participation to purchase a couple buildings essentially and we are pledging for other
city buildings to raise this financing a library and three firehouses talk last time we
have length about this I will just say I am not a supporter of certificates of
participation I believe it is a form of debt that goes behind the voters backs and allows
public officials to raise money that was not intended to be behind the scenes if we're
going to incur long-term obligations I think people always intended to have that go to
them as a vote this does not do that and therefore I am not willing to give permission for
24 million dollars worth of certificates of participation plus interest which may go up to
just shy of 10 million additional thank you councilman thoughts councilman Lopez thank you
mr. President I just want to disrespect I just want to sorry respectfully disagree what
would the opposite of that be disrespectfully agree respectfully agree respectfully
disagree with my it was a long week last week come on give it a break with my colleague
councilwoman Fox I think I think her reasons solid except when you look at the what the
facilities are for what it is for and its fire station and library facilities I think the
intent there is to make sure that we do have adequate fire protection we do have library
services these are values that we have as citizens and if you know when somebody shows up
to your door and an emergency and it's a firefighter or they're coming to perform their
fire duties the first thing we don't ask is how was your fire station built the fact that
it's built and the services are out so I do respect reasoning but I just disagree thank
you thank you supporting the councilman Lopez councilman Fauci back up thank you mr.
President I just want to clarify we are pledging the fire stations we're like we're
mortgaging them and we are mortgaging the library for something else so if worse came to
worse and we didn't pay the obligation they would come take the firehouses and they come
take the library so I don't quite follow that argument thank you councilman Fauci any
other comments 239 seeing none ma'am secretary roll call Fauci no each layman aye Lopez
aye Monteiro aye Nevett aye Ortega Rob aye Shepherd aye Sussman aye Brooks aye Brown aye

1a 239 has been placed on final consideration and does pass all right thankfully that's
all because our microphones are dying out we are ready for the block votes all other bills
for introduction or to publish councilman Brooks can you please put the resolutions on the
floor for adoption and a block yes a suppressant I uh should you want me to use this
michael do you think give it your best shot everybody turn them off except for now working

12 ayes bills placed on final consideration do pass in a block since there are no public

one pre adjournment announcement monday june 1st as set by council resolution 264 there
will be a required public hearing on the creation and establishment of the river north
business improvement district and on monday june 1st 2015 as set by council resolution 265
there will be a required public hearing on the creation and establishment of the river
north general denver general improvement district seeing no other business before this
body this meeting is adjourned
